alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 14 at 8:09PM AKDT until September 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Central Inner Channels and Eastern Gulf Coast. This includes the cities of Sitka, Juneau, And Petersburg. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. Isolated landslides remain possible in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - - An atmospheric river has so far brought moderate to heavy rainfall since Wednesday evening. Some rain rates have been heavy with upwards of 0.25 inches per hour observed at times. The heavy rainfall is starting to shift eastward away from the Sitka and Juneau areas in the central Panhandle. The Petersburg area will stay in the heavy rainfall until early Friday morning. Area rivers and streams have been showing rises in water levels but no flooding has been observed, yet. Minor flooding is possible especially for the smaller streams as they respond to the heavy rain. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; Petersburg Borough
